required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study to Evaluate the Safety for the Treatment of Inflammation Associated With Cataract Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 3, Prospective, Randomized, Parallel-design, Multicenter Study to Evaluate the Safety of Icon Bioscience-10090 for the Treatment of Inflammation Associated With Cataract Surgery

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events (TEAEs)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to postoperative day 90/ early termination
primary_outcome.description: Treatment-emergent Adverse Events were defined as events that started after the study drug administration, and occurred before termination of the study, or were present before study drug administration and worsened after dose administration.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Postoperative (POD) 1, POD 8, POD 30, POD 90/Early termination
secondary_outcome.description: Intraocular Pressure was measured by Goldmann applanation tonometry.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Postoperative (POD) 1, POD 8, POD 30, POD 90/Early termination
secondary_outcome.description: Visual Acuity assessed by the Snellen chart, was expressed as the logarithm of the minimum angle of resolution (logMAR), and could range from 0 (representing 20/20 vision) to 1

secondary_outcome.measure: Slit Lamp Biomicroscopy - Conjunctival Hyperemia Grade
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Postoperative (POD) 1, POD 8, POD 30, POD 90/Early termination
secondary_outcome.description: Slit lamp biomicroscopy of the anterior chamber was performed using a slit beam of 1-mm height and 1-mm width with maximum luminance through the highest-powered lens using the Investigator's standard slit lamp equipment and procedure. Conjunctiva hyperemia slit lamp results were summarized by treatment group and time point.

secondary_outcome.measure: Slit Lamp Biomicroscopy - Cornea Edema Grade
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Postoperative (POD) 1, POD 8, POD 30, POD 90/Early termination
secondary_outcome.description: Slit lamp biomicroscopy of the anterior chamber was performed using a slit beam of 1-mm height and 1-mm width with maximum luminance through the highest-powered lens using the Investigator's standard slit lamp equipment and procedure. Cornea edema slit lamp results in the study eye were summarized by treatment group and time point.

secondary_outcome.measure: Summary of Concomitant Medications Used in the Study Eye or Both Eyes
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Postoperative (POD) 1, POD 8, POD 30, POD 90/Early termination

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in the Corneal Endothelial Cell Count
secondary_outcome.description: Corneal Endothelial Cell Density was measured by specular microscopy.

secondary_outcome.measure: Optic Disc Cup-disc Ratio for the Study Eye
secondary_outcome.description: Calculated as the ratio of the diameter of the depression (cup) to that of the optical nerve head (disc).

secondary_outcome.measure: Dilated Opthalmoscopy Findings - Optic Disc (Study Eye)
secondary_outcome.description: The number and percentage of patients with normal or abnormal findings from dilated opthalmoscopy examination of the study eye's optic disc
The number and percentage of patients with normal or abnormal findings from dilated opthalmoscopy examination of the study eye's retina
The number and percentage of patients with normal or abnormal findings from dilated opthalmoscopy examination of the study eye's macula.
The number and percentage of patients with normal or abnormal findings from dilated opthalmoscopy examination of the study eye's choroid
The number and percentage of patients with normal or abnormal findings from dilated opthalmoscopy examination of the study eye's vitreous

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- undergoing cataract surgery
Exclusion Criteria:
- glaucoma patient, pregnancy, allergy to dexamethasone

participant_flow.recruitment_details: The first patient was enrolled into the study on 06 November 2015 and the last patient completed the study on 16 August 2016.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Of the 194 patients randomized, 181 patients were dosed and included in the ITT (intent-to-treat) and safety analysis sets. 13 randomized patients were not dosed and terminated from the study. Some of the patients that were not dosed had at least one significant protocol deviation.

group.title: Dexamethasone Depot
group.description: A single intraocular dose of dexamethasone (517 mcg) at the conclusion of cataract surgery

group.title: Prednisolone Drops 1% (Standard of Care)
group.description: Three weeks of treatment with prednisolone drops 1% (one drop, four times daily for three weeks)

group.title: Dexamethasone Depot
group.description: A single intraocular dose of dexamethasone (517 mcg) at the conclusion of cataract surgery

group.title: Prednisolone Drops 1% (Standard of Care)
group.description: Three weeks of treatment with prednisolone drops 1% (one drop, four times daily for three weeks)

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

category.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

measure.title: Best Corrected Visual Acuity
measure.description: Visual Acuity assessed by the Snellen chart, was expressed as the logarithm of the minimum angle of resolution (logMAR), and could range from 0 (representing 20/20 vision) to 1

measure.title: Corneal Endothelial Cell Density - Specular Microscopy
Use of Viscoelastic during the Surgery
Use of Femto prior to the Surgery

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events (TEAEs)
outcome.description: Treatment-emergent Adverse Events were defined as events that started after the study drug administration, and occurred before termination of the study, or were present before study drug administration and worsened after dose administration.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline to postoperative day 90/ early termination

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse event data was collected from screening until postoperative day 90/end of treatment.

group.title: Dexamethasone Depot
group.description: A single intraocular dose of dexamethasone (517 mcg) at the conclusion of cataract surgery

group.title: Prednisolone Drops 1% (Standard of Care)
group.description: Three weeks of treatment with prednisolone drops 1% (one drop, four times daily for three weeks)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
